page.title: 05Housing in Stratton
page.content: Stratton 1985 -agrarian village farmed by one family. Has a small public house, no Post Office, no shop, no railway halt, no school. Junior children are taken by bus to and from Charminster; seniors to Dorchester. A by-pass carries heavy traffic north of the village; the Frome runs to the south. The main street runs between. A row of derelict cottages abuts it.a few modernised thatched cottages still stand, having large gardens. Blocks of small new owner-occupied houses and flats predominate, with small gardens. Plans are in progress for larger homes each with minute gardens, showing suburban influence. Ash Hill is a small cluster of council houses away from Stratton itself, built in the 1950's. Some are now privately owned.
